comments.body: Here we add a first pythonization for Open, does your second pythonization interfere in some way with it?

I had a look and it does not seem to interfere, since the first pythonization just sets the creator flag on `Open` which means that the returned proxy will be owned by Python. Please check if, after your pythonization, Python still owns what `Open` returns (it should be the case).

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +49,53 @@    if name == 'TFile':
        # Pythonizations for TFile::Open
        AddFileOpenPyz(klass)
        klass._OriginalOpen = klass.Open
        klass.Open = classmethod(_TFileOpen)
